N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 860.35 - Ground water quality objectives

State Regulations
(a) Limits. The ground waters of the basin
shall not contain substances or properties attributable to the activities of
man in concentrations or amounts sufficient to endanger or preclude the water
uses to be protected. (1)

Within this
requirement, the ground waters shall be free from substances or properties in
concentrations or combinations which are toxic or harmful to human, animal, plant, or aquatic life, or that produce color, taste or odor of the
waters. (2)

Concentrations at any
point shall not be degraded by the activities of man to exceed values specified
by current U.S. Public Health Service Drinking Water Standards. (b) Nondegradation of ground
waters. It is the policy of the commission to prevent degradation of ground
water quality. In implementing this policy, the commission will require the
best water management determined to be practicable. No quality change will be
considered which, in the judgment of the commission, may be injurious to any
designated present or future ground or surface water use. Notes
